required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Chemotherapy on TMB in NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Platinum-based Chemotherapy on Tumor Mutation Burden in Patients With Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Tumor mutation burden is identified as an important biomarkers for predicting PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitors in advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer. Several previous clinical trials have demonstrated that chemotherapy could enhance the efficacy of PD-1/L1 immunotherapy in NSCLC such as Checkmate-227, Impower-150, Keynote-189, etc. Pre-clincial experiment shows that chemotherapy could increase CD8 TIL infiltration in tumor microenvironment, activate T cell immune reaction. However, it remains unclear whether chemotherapy could affect tumor mutation burden in advanced NSCLC patients. The present study aims to evaluate whether tumor mutation burden will change after receiving chemotherapy in advanced NSCLC patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: every 6 weeks up to progression disease
primary_outcome.description: Tumor mutation burden will be calculated using a 520 genes NGS panel

arm_group.description: All participants are advanced NSCLC without druggable gene mutation (EGFR, ALK, ROS-1, Met, Ret. BRAF, etc), who would receive platinum-based chemotherapy.

intervention.description: Tumor Mutation burden will be evaluated using NGS after 2-cycle chemotherapy, 4-cycle chemotherapy, or at progressive disease

biospec_descr.textblock: DNA from tumor tissue or circulating Tumor DNA

study_pop.textblock: Advanced NSCLC without druggable molecular events (EGFR, ALK, c-Met, BRAF, Ret, etc)
